Let H = C × R = {(z, r) | z ∈C, r > 0} be the three-dimensional Poincar´e
space which admits the following action of the group SL2(C):
(z, r)
\left(\begin{array}{cc} a \\ b \\ c \\ d \end{array}\right)
=
\left(
\frac{(az + b)(cz + d) + acr2}{|cz + d|2 + |c|2r2}
,
\frac{r}{|cz + d|2 + |c|2r2}
\right)
.
Let o be the ring of integers of the field K = Q(√D), where D < 0, π a prime such
that ππ is a prime in Z and let Γ =
{\left(\begin{array}{cc} a \\ b \\ c \\ d \end{array}\right) ∈SL2(o) | b ≡0 (mod π)}. Adding
to the space Γ \ H3 two vertices we get a three-dimensional compact space Γ \ H3.
Calculate r(π) = dim Q H1(Γ \ H3, Q) = dim Q(Γab ⊗Q).
For example, if D = −3 then r(π) is distinct from zero for the first time for π | 73
(then r(π) = 1), and if D = −4 then r(π) = 1 for π | 137.
H. Helling
